By James Bithell

Munisha Lall talks Prince, popularity and kissing each other with Rory and Grant of the Scottish indie foursome

By James Bithell

It's the final day of Brighton's best festival. Chris Owen reviews a third batch of freshly baked acts.

The Vaccines, Slaves, George The Poet and PINS are highlights on the Friday of TGE 2015. Chris Owen walks and talks us through a day packed with the best new music around

By James Bithell

Festivals 2015: The Great Escape - Day One

Nouse's coverage of Europe's biggest festival of new music begins with a run-down of Music Editor Chris Owen's first day in Brighton, featuring reviews of Jack Garratt, Kate Tempest and SOAK

Festivals 2015: The Great Escape Preview

As Europe's biggest new music festival prepares to celebrate its sold out 10th Birthday, here's a look at the hottest picks for The Great Escape 2015

The Vinyl Countdown

Ben Phillips delves into the resurgence of vinyl records

Spector: "Everyone should stop taking themselves so seriously"

By James Bithell

Fred Macpherson, lead singer of indie rock band Spector, tells Ricky Jones why he thinks the music industry needs to lighten up

Spotlight On...Luxo Jr

York students Laurence, Tom, Michael and Nick talk to Chris Owen about live shows, their musical influences and making it on to BBC radio

Hudson Taylor: "Irish artists are really supporting each other"

Alfie Hudson-Taylor, one half of the breakout folk-rock duo, talks busking, music trends and life in a band of brothers

Slaves: New kids on the rock

Isaac Holman is one half of the latest British rock duo to take the UK's venues by storm. Lara Shannon gets the insight from the enigmatic drummer on what it takes to make rock music fresh again

Spotlight On...RHODES

Lily Papworth talks touring friendships, childhood obsessions and the art of musical intimacy with the latest singer-songwriter poised for imminent acclaim

Marika Hackman: "I feel like I am trying to create a new type of folk."

Marika Hackman discusses Shakespearean characters, Choral music and Pre-Raphaelite artists with Ellie Langford

Bipolar Sunshine: "I'd love to collaborate with Mike Skinner, Kanye, and Florence & the Machine."

Bipolar Sunshine a.k.a. Adio Marchant explains to Lara Shannon the concept behind his moniker and why England creates the best music

Fall Out Boy: An Evolution

Beki Elmer gives her verdict on latest album American Beauty/American Psycho, genre conversion and the changing dynamics of the rock industry.

Cult Heroes: Scott Walker

From teen idol to reclusive producer of gloomy, avant-garde experimentalism - An introduction to Scott Walker

Spotlight On...Birmingham's rock revolution

Our latest spotlight on the new and undiscovered takes us to the Midlands as Ben Phillips introduces God Damn and Youth Man, two up-and-coming rock outfits to watch

Rae Morris: The freedom of release

Finally stepping into a spotlight of her own with the release of Unguarded, the singer-songwriter of the moment talks lyrics, touring and Twitter with Hatti Linnell

Jameela Jamil: "It doesn't make sense and it doesn't reflect society"

Jameela explains to Chris Owen why her company 'Why Not People?' organises ordinary gigs for disabled individuals, and how she's enlisted Chris Martin and Ed Sheeran to help her cause

American Authors: "I love the people of the UK, I love the beer."

The breakout pop-rock foursome talk to Nouse

On The Radar: Florence + The Machine, East India Youth, Joey Bada$$, HONNE & Courtney Barnett

Music Editor Chris Owen's five picks of the week

Spotlight On...Meanwhile

Up-and-coming electronic maestro Tom Andrews talks to Chris Agathangelou about small-town ambition, writing visuals and which of the X-Men he'd most like to be

York Live Music Calendar: February

Nouse's comprehensive list of the must-see events this February

The Ting Tings: "I wouldn't expect a polished live show. It's not us"

"We've gotten to our third album by not selling ourselves out." The Ting Tings have a chat with Jack Elliott

Backstage with Coasts

Straight off the back of their appearance at Zane Lowe's Future Festival, Chris Caines talks band dynamics with Emily McDonnell

2015 Pop Forecast

Chris Owen predicts which acts will be breaking through, and who'll be heading for the door

The Ultimate Record Store Guide

Callum McCulloch takes us on a tour of York that's edgier than a 180g piece of black plastic.

Spotlight On...Guitar Wolf

Jack Richardson introduces us to the art of Japanese garage rock

York Live Music Calendar: January

Some crucial dates for the gig diary
